content.description:
SDS at the base of the arete at some incut jugs and surf the overhanging arete up and right to a point where it becomes vertical then finish up easy slab to the top.

A spotter is nice to have for the inverted moves and several rocks at the base.
content.location: The southeast arete of the boulder.

content.description: SDS at a jug below a short overhang and make a long reach/toss to an incut hueco over the lip and then continue up the less than vertical face on amazing holds.
content.location: Center of the east face and just right of a large block at the base.

content.description:
SDS at jugs and power up the overhanging face on incut buckets to an easy mantle at the lip.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location:
About 8' right of

Tosspint

and just left of a small boulder at the base.

content.description: This is a traverse right from the 'Tosspint' start hold. Traverse right to small crimpy flakes topping out on the shelf on the right of the arete
content.protection: Crash pads. Good landing area but s couple rocks on the floor of the landing zone. Just cover with a pad.
content.location: This problem is located on the Mullet Bloc 2 or also called the Lox Boulder about 20 feet up the base of the mountain from the Mullet Block.
